009
010package imagingbook.common.sift.scalespace;
011
012import java.io.PrintStream;
013
014import imagingbook.common.util.PrintsToStream;
015
016
017/**
018 * <p>
019 * This abstract class defines a generic hierarchical scale space, consisting of
020 * multiple "octaves". See Sec. 25.1.4. of [1] for details.
021 * </p>
022 * <p>
023 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
024 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
025 * </p>
026 * 
027 * @author WB
028 * @version 2022/11/20
029 * @see ScaleLevel
030 * @see ScaleOctave
031 * @see GaussianScaleSpace
032 * @see DogScaleSpace
033 */
034public abstract class HierarchicalScaleSpace implements PrintsToStream {
035        
036        protected final int P;                                          // number of octaves
037        protected final int Q;                                          // number of levels per octave
038        protected final double sigma_s;                         // absolute scale of original image
039        protected final double sigma_0;                         // absolute base scale of first octave (level 0,0)
040        protected final int botLevel, topLevel;         // bottom and top level index in each octave
041        protected final ScaleOctave[] octaves;          
042        
043        HierarchicalScaleSpace(int P, int Q, double sigma_s, double sigma_0, int botLevel, int topLevel) {
044                this.Q = Q;
045                this.P = P;
046                this.sigma_s = sigma_s;
047                this.sigma_0 = sigma_0;
048                this.botLevel = botLevel;
049                this.topLevel = topLevel;
050                octaves = new ScaleOctave[P];   
051        }
052        
053        public int getP() {
054                return P;
055        }
056        
057        public int getQ() {
058                return Q;
059        }
060        
061        public double getSigma_s() {
062                return sigma_s;
063        }
064        
065        public double getSigma_0() {
066                return sigma_0;
067        }
068        
069        public ScaleOctave getOctave(int p) {
070                return octaves[p];
071        }
072        
073        public ScaleLevel getScaleLevel(int p, int q) {
074                return getOctave(p).getLevel(q);
075        }
076        
077//      public float getValue(int p, int q, int u, int v) {
078//              ScaleLevel level = getLevel(p,q);
079//              return level.getf(u, v);
080//      }
081        
082        public int getScaleIndex(int p, int q) {
083                int m = Q * p + q; 
084                return m;
085        }
086        
087        public float getScaleIndexFloat(float p, float q) {
088                float m = Q * p + q; 
089                return m;
090        }
091        
092        public double getAbsoluteScale(int p, float q) {
093                double m = Q * p + q;
094                return sigma_0 * Math.pow(2, m/Q);
095        }
096        
097        public double getRelativeScale(double scaleA, double scaleB) {  // scaleA <= scaleB
098                if (scaleA > scaleB) {
099                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("getRelativeScale(): scaleA > scaleB");
100                }
101                return Math.sqrt(scaleB*scaleB - scaleA*scaleA);
102        }
103        
104        /**
105         * Calculates and returns the real (unscaled) x-position for a
106         * local coordinate at the specified octave.
107         * 
108         * @param p the octave index
109         * @param xp the (scale-level) local coordinate
110         * @return the original x-position
111         */
112        public double getRealX(int p, double xp) {
113                return Math.pow(2, p) * xp;     // TODO: optimize (precalculate Math.pow(p, 2))
114        }
115        
116        /**
117         * Calculates and returns the real (unscaled) y-position for a
118         * local coordinate at the specified octave.
119         * 
120         * @param p the octave index
121         * @param yp the scale-level) local coordinate
122         * @return the original y-position
123         */
124        public double getRealY(int p, double yp) {
125                return Math.pow(2, p) * yp;
126        }
127        
128        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
129        
130        @Override
131        public void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
132                strm.println("Hierarchical Scale Space (" + this.getClass().getSimpleName() + ")");
133                for (ScaleOctave oct : octaves) {
134                        oct.printToStream(strm);
135                        strm.println();
136                }
137        }
138        
139        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
140        
141        public void show() {
142                show("");
143        }
144        
145        public void show(String title) {
146                if (!title.isEmpty()) {
147                        title = title + ": ";
148                }
149                for (int p = 0; p < P; p++) {
150                        octaves[p].showAsStack(title + "Octave " + p);
151                }
152        }
153        
154}
